004package kut;
005
006import java.util.ArrayList;
007import java.util.Arrays;
008import java.util.regex.Pattern;
009
010/** String management. */
011public class Str {
012  Str () {}
013
014  /**
015   * Compares two strings using the Sys.collator.
016   * @param s1 First String.
017   * @param s2 Second String.
018   * @return -1 if s1 &lt; s1, 0 if s1 == s2 and 1 if s1 > s2.
019   */
020  public static int cmp (String s1, String s2) {
021    return Sys.collator.compare(s1, s2);
022  }
023
024  /**
025   * Returns a String using 'fm'.<br>
026   * See <a href="https://docs.oracle.com/en/java/javase/17/docs/api/java.base/java/util/Formatter.html">
027   * Formatter</a>.
028   * @param fm Format string.
029   * @param args 'fm' arguments.
030   * @return 'fm' sustitutiyng variables by arguments.
031   */
032  public static String fmt (String fm, Object... args) {
033    return new java.util.Formatter().format(fm, args).toString();
034  }
035
036  /**
037   * Returns String from 'byte[]' codified in ISO-8859-15.
038   * @param bs String codified in ISO-8859-15.
039   * @return String
040   */
041  public static String fromIso (byte[] bs) {
042    try {
043      return new String(bs, "ISO-8859-15");
044    } catch (java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
045      throw new IllegalArgumentException(e);
046    }
047  }
048
049  /**
050   * Returns String from 'byte[]' codified in UTF-8.
051   * @param bs String codified in UTF-8.
052   * @return String
053   */
054  public static String fromUtf8 (byte[] bs) {
055    try {
056      return new String(bs, "UTF-8");
057    } catch (java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
058      throw new IllegalArgumentException(e);
059    }
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Equals to sub(s, 0, n).
064   * @param s String to cut.
065   * @param n Number of characters.
066   * @return 'sub(s, 0, n)'.
067   */
068  public static String left (String s, int n) {
069    return sub(s, 0, n);
070  }
071
072  /**
073   * Removes left blanks.
074   * @param s String to cut.
075   * @return A new String.
076   */
077  public static String ltrim (String s) {
078    return left((s + "|").trim(), -1);
079  }
080
081  /**
082   * Returns a String with the character 'ch'
083   * @param ch Character.
084   * @return String
085   */
086  public static String newC (char ch) {
087    return String.valueOf(ch);
088  }
089
090  /**
091   * Quotes 's', replacing '"' by '\"' and '\' by '\\'. (e.g. a"bc -> "a\"bc")
092   * @param s String to quote.
093   * @return 's' quoted.
094   */
095  public static String quote (String s) {
096    return "\"" + s.replace("\\", "\\\\").replace("\"", "\\\"") + "\"";
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Equals to sub(s, n, s.length()).
101   * @param s String to cut.
102   * @param n Number of characters.
103   * @return 'sub(s, 0, n)'.
104   */
105  public static String right (String s, int n) {
106    return sub(s, n, s.length());
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Removes right blanks.
111   * @param s String to cut.
112   * @return String.
113   */
114  public static String rtrim (String s) {
115    return ("|" + s).trim().substring(1);
116  }
117
118  /**
119   * Splits a String with the 'sep'.<p>
120   * Examples:<p>
121   *   sys.test(arr.size(str.split("", "")), 0);<br>
122   *   sys.test(arr.join(str.split("", ""), ""), "");<br>
123   *   sys.test(arr.size(str.split("a", "")), 1);<br>
124   *   sys.test(arr.join(str.split("a", ""), ""), "a");<br>
125   *   sys.test(arr.size(str.split("añ", "")), 2);<br>
126   *   sys.test(arr.join(str.split("añ", ""), ""), "añ");<br>
127   *   sys.test(arr.size(str.split("", ";")), 1;<br>
128   *   sys.test(arr.join(str.split("", ";"), ";"), "");<br>
129   *   sys.test(arr.size(str.split("ab;cd;", ";")), 3);<br>
130   *   sys.test(arr.join(str.split("ab;cd;", ";"), ";"), "ab;cd;");<br>
131   *   sys.test(arr.size(str.split("ab;cd", ";")), 2);<br>
132   *   sys.test(arr.join(str.split("ab;cd", ";"), ";"), "ab;cd")
133   * @param s String to split.
134   * @param sep Separator to use.
135   * @return Array.
136   */
137  public static ArrayList<String> split (String s, String sep) {
138    if (s.equals("")) {
139      if (sep.equals("")) return new ArrayList<>();
140      return new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(""));
141    }
142    ArrayList<String> r =
143      new ArrayList<>(Arrays.asList(s.split(Pattern.quote(sep))));
144    if (!sep.equals("") && s.endsWith(sep)) {
145      r.add("");
146      if (s.equals(sep)) r.add("");
147    }
148    return r;
149  }
150
151  /**
152   * Equals to 'split' but 'trimming' strings.
153   * @param s String to split.
154   * @param sep Separator to use.
155   * @return Array.
156   */
157  public static ArrayList<String> splitTrim (String s, String sep) {
158    ArrayList<String> r = split(s, sep);
159    for (int i = 0; i < r.size(); ++i) r.set(i, r.get(i).trim());
160    return r;
161  }
162
163  /**
164   * Returns characters of 's' between 'begin' inclusive and 'end' exclusive.
165   * @param s String to cut.
166   * @param begin If it is less than 0, it is set to s.length() + begin. If it
167   *  is less than 0 yet, it is set to 0. If it is greater than s.length(),
168   *  it is set to s.length().
169   * @param end If it is less than 0, it is set to s.length() + begin. If then
170   *  it is less than begin, it is set to begin. If it is greater than s.length(),
171   *  it is set to s.length().
172   * @return String.
173   */
174  public static String sub (String s, int begin, int end) {
175    int sz = s.length();
176    if (begin < 0) {
177      begin = sz + begin;
178      if (begin < 0) begin = 0;
179    }
180    if (begin > sz) begin = sz;
181    if (end < 0) end = sz + end;
182    if (end < begin) end = begin;
183    if (end > sz) end = sz;
184
185    return s.substring(begin, end);
186  }
187
188  /**
189   *  Returns 'byte[]' codified in ISO-8859-15 from String.
190   * @param s String
191   * @return Bytes.
192   */
193  public static byte[] toIso (String s) {
194    try {
195      return s.getBytes("ISO-8859-15");
196    } catch (java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
197      throw new IllegalArgumentException(e);
198    }
199  }
200
201  /**
202   *  Returns 'byte[]' codified in UTF-8 from String.
203   * @param s String
204   * @return Bytes.
205   */
206  public static byte[] toUtf8 (String s) {
207    try {
208      return s.getBytes("UTF-8");
209    } catch (java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException e) {
210      throw new IllegalArgumentException(e);
211    }
212  }
213}
